main event: A civilian reported observing a bright, fast-moving star-like object in Dayton, Ohio, during the daytime in July 1963, and another sighting was reported on July 7, 1968, for approximately three minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as being round and sized significantly larger than a typical star,The object hovered before moving slowly eastward and then accelerating rapidly,The witness reported no sound associated with the object,Multiple sightings were reported over the years in Dayton, including one involving three minutes of observation,Formal inquiries were made to the Air Force about these sightings, but no definitive conclusion could be reached.
witness description: A civilian observing from a building
